[LEXICON]: Abrupt inclusion of unrelated historical/artistic references (e.g., Michelangelo, George III, Bahá’u’lláh) disrupts thematic consistency.
[SYNTAX]: Sudden, unmarked shifts between sci-fi dialogue and non-sequitur paragraphs (e.g., "No doubt, political corruption...") create jarring transitions.

[LOGIC]: Non-sequitur paragraphs (e.g., art history, monarchic governance) have no discernible connection to the Irwadi nationalization plot, fracturing narrative cohesion.
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt scene changes (e.g., from Polaris to Englander’s flat) lack bridging transitions, though context is partially retained.

[LEXICON]: Inconsistent quotation formatting for internal monologue ("Ah yes...").
